analyzed: theḥ apadāna  padu mukkhi pa vagga
translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Padumuttara
“Under the Bodhi Tree of the Fortunate One, Tissa,
a sapling of the Bodhi Tree,
to the tree that grows on the earth.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Bodhi Tree.
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the elder Aḍḍhacandiya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā aḍḍhacandiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Aḍḍhacandiyattherassāpadānaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai aḍḍhacandiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽aḍḍhacandiya therassa apadānam
translated: The Elder Aḍḍhacandiya’s Birth Story, the third.
